The lawsuit was filed by the conservativ: leaning Public Interest Legal Foundation, blaming the city of Detroit's poor voter registration upkeep for various issues such as duplicate registrations, more registered voters than eligible voters, and deceased registered voters.
The screenshot of the news segment summa: Twitter, and Instagram in multiple languages.
The screenshot was from a December 2019: and the numbers mentioned in the lawsuit have no relation to the 2020 general election.
The City of Detroit clerk: Janice Winfrey, stated that the voter roll update was regular maintenance and the case of the voter born in 1823 was a typographical error. The lawsuit's concerns were addressed and resolved by the city.
